description.p: Having graduated from the wycademy, you chose to continue your studies dedicating your life to becoming an expert in your chosen field. Now you have struck out to increase your knowledge, for good or evil, for everyone or for yourself, that is up to you to decide.

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Investigation; Choose one from Animal Handling, Athletics, History, Insight, Nature, Survival
Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan tools

Equipment: A bottle of black ink, a quill, a small knife, a partially filled journal filled with notes and questions you have not yet been able to answer, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

tr.td: Exotic Monsters from Far Off Lands

b.big: As a member of the Wycademy you are granted additional features:

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I am quiet and analytical.
I am tireless when researching or learning, which I always seem to be doing.
I try to travel to all the important places of a region to see them firsthand.
I am a voracious reader and spend every spare moment learning about new things or writing.
I enjoy an intellectual challenge.
I've read every book in the world's greatest libraries- or I like to boast that I have.
I have learned that doing your research before a hunt leads to a safer hunt.
I'm convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.

select.name: Ideals
select.item: Improvement. Understanding history gives us a chance to make a better world. (Good)
Knowledge. The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)
Discover. Knowledge can accomplish anything; you cannot hope to master it, only marvel at it.
Vanity. I deserve to be treated as a an important person because of what I know. (Evil)
Logic. Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking. (Lawful)
Self-Improvement. The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself. (Any)

select.name: Bonds
select.item: I have ancient text that holds terrible secrets that must not fall into the wrong hands.
I work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, or monastery.
My life's work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.
I investigated a fascinating and beautiful monster; I must see it again.
I am determined to cure the disease that killed my family.
I need to be known for my contributions, discoveries, and skill.

select.name: Flaws
select.item: I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
What's the point of secrets? All knowledge should be shared.
I feel superior to uneducated folk, but quietly so.
Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
I will endanger my friends and family if I think it will advance my research.
I prove my intellect by pointing out others mistakes.

description.p: Expanding the knowledge of your research is an important aspect of your job at the Wycademy. When you discover new information about a creature or resource related to your research, you can bring that information to a Wycademy owned location to receive a stipend. Discuss with your DM what that amount is and if you can make more depending on what you discover or as you level up.
